channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [GROOVY-2152] Stacktrace in the new shell
item.description:
I have some difficulties reproducing this bug, as I'm not 100% sure what's causing it exactly, but it seems that when you launch the shell (with the NEWSHELL var env set), when you start typing some uncomplete statement, and then hit Escape, you can get the huge and horrible stacktrace below:

C:\Documents and Settings\Guillaume Laforge>groovysh
Groovy Shell (1.1-beta-3, JVM: 1.6.0_02-b06)
Type 'help' or '\h' for help.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Do you have any examples which tend to cause this to happen? And this is on windows na?

I'm on Windows XP.
And I don't always get this error.
I can't seem to reproduce this bug each time
But I'll keep trying till I find a good use case producing this.
Okay, if you get something that pukes most of the time I can probably fix it... but its gonna be hard to track down if its so random.
How often would you say this happens? I can add a hack to catch that StringIndexOutOfBoundsException as a short-term work-around if this is painful for you. Lemme know.
It happens, say, once out of ten, or something like that.
Okay, hack added... lemme know how it helps... if it does at all.

I have played even more with the new shell but don't encounter that error anymore since the hack.
Thanks Jason.
